definition: old hand/veteran

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: "Some of the veteran guys were like, "Oh OK, he switched off.

sentences.english: There are no good pilots, only old pilots.

sentences.english: The old birds or the fostered young would gain an advantage .

sentences.english: Old birds are hard to pluck.
